scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L is a star with 1.06 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 13108.21 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L system


OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L b

OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2013-01, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 4.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L b is 46.110 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L b is 7.720 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L c

OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L c was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2013-01, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 4.80 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L c is 273.480 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L c is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2012-BLG-0026L - System With 2 Exoplanets
